item.description:
Please join us for our regular monthly meetup and gather some wild black raspberries!

The black raspberries should be ripe and the wild berry patch is a great spot for a brief talk on how different plants reclaim the land through a series of successional growths. We'll also talk a bit about "invasives"- how and why they appear and a bit about the controversy over their bad reputations.

This meetup is schuduled to start earlier than usual to allow people to spend a little more time picking berries. Those who can't arrive at 6:30 are welcome to join the group later!

Loose agenda:
6:30 Meet and greet in the house
6:45 Move to the berry patch and start picking
7:00 Start talk on succession and invasives and continue picking
7:45 Share a potluck meal
8:30 Wrap up and take your berries home

Please:
Bring a collection container for your berries
Wear appropriate clothing for wading through grass and dealing with thorns
Bring a potluck dish to share with the group
item.how_to_find_us: I'll be the gal in the berry patch
item.name: Monthly Meetup- Wild Berry Picking Potluck
